UI_visible_response: In 2020, a serious accident occurred at the Songzao Coal Mine in Chongqing, China. On September 27, a fire broke out on an uphill conveyor belt with a large dip angle, designated as No. 2, which was used to transport coal1. This fire produced lethal levels of carbon monoxide gas, leading to the tragic deaths of 16 miners due to carbon monoxide poisoning9.Additionally, in December 2020, another incident at the same mine resulted in at least 23 deaths during a salvage operation following a coal mine accident2. These incidents highlighted significant safety concerns within the mining industry in China, prompting discussions about the effectiveness of government inspections and safety measures5.
traffic_visible_response: In 2020, a serious accident occurred at the Songzao Coal Mine in Chongqing, China. On September 27, a fire broke out on an uphill conveyor belt with a large dip angle, designated as No. 2, which was used to transport coal [[1]]. This fire produced lethal levels of carbon monoxide gas, leading to the tragic deaths of 16 miners due to carbon monoxide poisoning [[9]]. Additionally, in December 2020, another incident at the same mine resulted in at least 23 deaths during a salvage operation following a coal mine accident [[2]]. These incidents highlighted significant safety concerns within the mining industry in China, prompting discussions about the effectiveness of government inspections and safety measures [[5]].
